channel.title: return address overwrite on The Mess Of Nebula
channel.description: Recent content in return address overwrite on The Mess Of Nebula

item.title: AHCTF2021: NameCheck
item.description: For the birds It has been a while since I have blogged. The importance of doing so has not been absent only outweighed by the inertia(that dread to begin). This is the start of an attempt to put more of my thoughts on e-paper. I also maintain a telegram space where I dump materials/resources I encounter as I go along. Checksec [*] '/home/levanto/Documents/Return-To-ROP/ChasingFlags/AHCTF/finals/namecheck' Arch: i386-32-little RELRO: Partial RELRO Stack: No canary found NX: NX disabled PIE: No PIE (0x8048000) RWX: Has RWX segments .

item.title: MicroCorruption: Johannesburg
item.description: At this point in the journey, you expect a manual to greet you: The lock is attached to HSM-1 module. Passwords that are very long are rejected. Just how long is too long? The main function just calls login. The prompt states the password range should be within 8 - 16 characters long. However, from the input parameters of the getsn function: r14: Holds length of the input buffer; 0x3f(63) characters.

item.title: MicroCorruption: Montevideo
item.description: You find a manual: This lock is attached to HSM-2 module. This means, no unlock door function in the lock firmware. This reminds you of a while back in WhiteHorse. The code follows internal secure development process. mmh. The main function just calls login. The prompt states for an input range of 8 - 16 characters. However, from the input to getsn function: r14: this holds the length of the input buffer; 0x30(48) characters.

item.title: MicroCorruption: Whitehorse
item.description: Slaps you with a manual: This lock is attached to a HSM-2 module. Function to unlock door no longer in the lock firmware. The main function just calls login. You set a breakpoint at login and a quick test input of aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa The login function: The prompt gives a range for input to be between 8 to 16 characters. However, the parameters for the getsn function: r14: Holds the length of the input buffer.
